description.narrative: IFC's investment is expected to: - Support a local producer to expand its exports which will contribute positively to generation of foreign currency in Egypt. Wadi currently exports fruits, vegetables, packaged foods and cell pads (industrial cooling solutions), and has recently starting exporting large animal feed, mainly to Jordan and GCC countries. Furthermore, Wadi produces soy bean meal and mono-calcium phosphate (MCP) locally, which would otherwise need to be imported (Wadi is the only producer of MCP in Egypt). - Increase farmer and SME reach. The Company purchases olives, vegetables, and other agricultural products from more than 70 local farms. Wadi also currently reaches more than 1,500 small farmers through sales of its day-old chicks and poultry feed. As it enters new product markets, Wadi will grow its reach to additional farmers and value chains, increasing its economic reach through distributors and suppliers. - Create direct and indirect jobs, by making the Company's funding sources more sustainable. Wadi currently has more than 3,000 employees.

mailing-address.narrative: Wadi Holdings SAE Mr. Ramy Youssef Chief Financial Officer +20 2 3827 8203 ramy.youssef@wadigroup.com.eg Capital Business Park, 26th of July Corridor Sheikh Zayed, 6th October City, Building B1, Giza, Egypt www.wadigroup.com
